page.title: 12WEATHER
page.content: St. Andrews attracts many visitors all year and as a result the weather is an important factor to take into consideration. Being on the East coast, summers are warm and winters are cool. Rainfall is fairly light,averaging 680mm/year, and is evenly distributed all year. Hours of sunshine, however, are not as high as one might expect. One of the weather phenomenon experienced in St. Andrews is the East coast haar. Especially after a warm sunny day, sea breezes build up in the afternoon and the colder air from the sea brings in a sea fog which is decidely chilling. Winter snowfall is very slight and it is unusual to have snow lying for any length of time.
